title: Frontier Airlines flight from Houston to Dallas canceled after Pilot arrest
content: A Frontier Airlines flight from Houston to Dallas was canceled after the pilot, Seymour Walker, was arrested for an assault-family violence warrant. Passengers saw Walker being escorted off the plane by three officers. The airline offered affected passengers refunds, credit, or re-accommodation on another flight later that evening, along with a $100 flight voucher.
summary: A Frontier Airlines flight from Houston to Dallas was canceled after the pilot, Seymour Walker, was arrested for an assault-family violence warrant. Passengers saw Walker being escorted off the plane by three officers. The airline offered affected passengers refunds, credit, or re-accommodation on another flight later that evening, along with a $100 flight voucher.

title: 'Imagine the guilt': Nancy Pelosi opens up about husband's attack, reflects on political legacy
content: Nancy Pelosi discussed the traumatic attack on her husband, Paul Pelosi, in which he was severely injured. Both have avoided discussing the event as advised by doctors. Pelosi's book, "The Art of Power," addresses her political career and family perspectives. She also denied pressuring President Joe Biden to drop out of his re-election campaign and offered advice for Kamala Harris whom she had publicly endorsed earlier.
summary: Nancy Pelosi discussed the traumatic attack on her husband, Paul Pelosi, in which he was severely injured. Both have avoided discussing the event as advised by doctors. Pelosi's book, "The Art of Power," addresses her political career and family perspectives. She also denied pressuring President Joe Biden to drop out of his re-election campaign and offered advice for Kamala Harris whom she had publicly endorsed earlier.

Why Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's visit to Colombia drawing fiery criticism?
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's announcement of an unofficial royal tour to Colombia has sparked criticism. They plan to visit Bogota, Cartagena, and Cali at the invitation of Vice President Francia Marquez. This follows their visit to Nigeria in May, marking their second unofficial diplomatic trip this year. Royal author Angela Levin criticized the tour, citing safety concerns in Colombia and accusing the Sussexes of manipulating King Charles.
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's announcement of an unofficial royal tour to Colombia has sparked criticism. They plan to visit Bogota, Cartagena, and Cali at the invitation of Vice President Francia Marquez. This follows their visit to Nigeria in May, marking their second unofficial diplomatic trip this year. Royal author Angela Levin criticized the tour, citing safety concerns in Colombia and accusing the Sussexes of manipulating King Charles.

title: VP campaign launches 'Republicans for Harris' in push to win over GOP voters put off by Trump
content: Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign launched “Republicans for Harris” to appeal to Republican voters disillusioned with Donald Trump. The program aims to engage GOP voters directly, emphasizing primary supporters of Nikki Haley. Prominent Republicans, including former officials and legislators, have backed Harris, stressing her commitment to democracy and opposing Trump's return to the White House.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign launched “Republicans for Harris” to appeal to Republican voters disillusioned with Donald Trump. The program aims to engage GOP voters directly, emphasizing primary supporters of Nikki Haley. Prominent Republicans, including former officials and legislators, have backed Harris, stressing her commitment to democracy and opposing Trump's return to the White House.

title: China issues plan to boost household consumption
content: China's State Council released directives to boost household consumption including sectors like child and elder care, and food and beverage. Authorities are urged to increase eldercare services and childcare development, alongside income tax reductions for caring for children and seniors. Financial support for small service businesses and promotion of food-themed festivals also featured in the plan.
summary: China's State Council released directives to boost household consumption including sectors like child and elder care, and food and beverage. Authorities are urged to increase eldercare services and childcare development, alongside income tax reductions for caring for children and seniors. Financial support for small service businesses and promotion of food-themed festivals also featured in the plan.

title: US court upholds rule granting work permits for spouses of visa holders
content: A US appeals court rejected the challenge to a regulation allowing spouses of H-1B visa holders to work, a rule implemented under President Obama. The court stated that federal immigration law grants the Department of Homeland Security broad regulatory authority, unaffected by a recent Supreme Court ruling limiting agency powers.
summary: A US appeals court rejected the challenge to a regulation allowing spouses of H-1B visa holders to work, a rule implemented under President Obama. The court stated that federal immigration law grants the Department of Homeland Security broad regulatory authority, unaffected by a recent Supreme Court ruling limiting agency powers.

title: Foreign nationals told to leave Lebanon as war fears surge
content: France and other nations urged foreign nationals to leave Lebanon due to escalating tensions. Hezbollah, backed by Iran, fired rockets at Israel. Meanwhile, Israeli strikes continue in Gaza amidst a protracted conflict with Hamas. The situation raised concerns about a potential wider conflict following the assassination of key militant leaders.
summary: France and other nations urged foreign nationals to leave Lebanon due to escalating tensions. Hezbollah, backed by Iran, fired rockets at Israel. Meanwhile, Israeli strikes continue in Gaza amidst a protracted conflict with Hamas. The situation raised concerns about a potential wider conflict following the assassination of key militant leaders.

title: Two dead in Israel stabbing, assailant killed: medics
content: Two people were killed and two others injured in a stabbing attack in Holon, near Tel Aviv. The attack was carried out by a Palestinian suspect from the Israeli-occupied West Bank, who was 'neutralized' by police and later died in hospital. The incident coincides with heightened regional tensions and follows threats of retaliation against Israel by groups backed by Iran.
summary: Two people were killed and two others injured in a stabbing attack in Holon, near Tel Aviv. The attack was carried out by a Palestinian suspect from the Israeli-occupied West Bank, who was 'neutralized' by police and later died in hospital. The incident coincides with heightened regional tensions and follows threats of retaliation against Israel by groups backed by Iran.

title: Ukraine intensifies its long-range strikes, sinking a Russian submarine and striking an airfield
content: Ukraine reported having sunk a Russian submarine and struck an airfield within the last 24 hours, in a series of long-range attacks. These actions come amid increased pressure on Western allies for long-range missile use. Russia indicated that Ukrainian drones also hit an apartment building, causing one casualty. The attacks targeted key Russian military infrastructures.
summary: Ukraine reported having sunk a Russian submarine and struck an airfield within the last 24 hours, in a series of long-range attacks. These actions come amid increased pressure on Western allies for long-range missile use. Russia indicated that Ukrainian drones also hit an apartment building, causing one casualty. The attacks targeted key Russian military infrastructures.

title: NASA welcomes first Isro astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to International Space Station
Fears of Middle East war grow after Hamas leader's killing
content: Tensions surged in the Middle East as Iran and allies prepared to retaliate for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, blamed on Israel. The US is deploying military assets to support Israel. Iran's allies and Hezbollah have vowed revenge, raising fears of a wider regional conflict. Western governments advised citizens to leave Lebanon.
summary: Tensions surged in the Middle East as Iran and allies prepared to retaliate for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, blamed on Israel. The US is deploying military assets to support Israel. Iran's allies and Hezbollah have vowed revenge, raising fears of a wider regional conflict. Western governments advised citizens to leave Lebanon.

title: Violent protests in UK: Over 90 arrested as far-right demonstrations turn into riots
UK government vows 'consequences' for far-right rioters
content: The UK government condemned recent violent disorder after police arrested dozens of people during far-right rallies. The unrest, sparked by false rumors about a mass stabbing that killed three young girls, spread across several cities. Prime Minister Keir Starmer vowed strict action against the perpetrators and backed the police to maintain public safety.
summary: The UK government condemned recent violent disorder after police arrested dozens of people during far-right rallies. The unrest, sparked by false rumors about a mass stabbing that killed three young girls, spread across several cities. Prime Minister Keir Starmer vowed strict action against the perpetrators and backed the police to maintain public safety.
